name: Soccer Manager 2017
description: Soccer Manager 2017 - Play for Free, Compete for Real. The most diverse FREE 2 PLAY football management simulator in the world. Take on a top flight club and test your management skills against the best or help a struggling, lower division team fight for glory.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or Later Processor: 1 GHz or higher Memory: 1 GB RAM Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 80 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Waste of time. you need to buy the virtual currency to even sign new players.

Very good football manager simulation game. Its free and seems to be even better than Football Manager to me as they dont tack on ♥♥♥♥♥♥ 3D graphics that are ugly, they just stick to text/2D style which is much better.  A lot of false reviews say you must pay for transfers. This is not true you can play this game 100% free. Of course there are going to be OPTIONAL micro-transactions in a F2P game, how do you expect the devs to make some money back? Its only fair and once again, it is completely optional you can sign big players if you're a big club, so its realistic.  I would recommend this game to anyone who likes football.

I'm going to start off by saying that this game is much better than I thought it would be.  I played Soccer Manager 2015 and 2016 and I wasn't entirely impressed by them. I felt they were lacking and had a few problems that seem to have been worked out. *Note - This isn't anything close to how Football Manager is, so don't go in expecting that.  I'm currently playing the game as a placeholder I suppose for the lack of a better name until Football Manager 2017 comes out. You can start off with any team you want. Player ratings are done a bit weird, but it isn't a big deal. For the most part, transfer budgets are fairly small (about 20ish million). That budget is the norm for all big teams as far as I know. You can purchase 'Cash Injections' but you really don't need too, it is very easy to make money (Raise youth players and sell them, bring in players on free transfers and sell them, sell fringe players, etc. If you're losing money every month then that means you have a player who has a very large wage and you don't have enough cash so becareful of that.)   The game does 1 thing that I've seen never before in Football Manager: Players arrive late for training and don't perform well. I thought that was a cool and interesting feature, and funny when it was Nicklas Bendtner that did it.  Games go by very quick, not much to them. Pick one of the few formations available, set few tactics, and you can assign player roles. All games are done on a 2D match engine. I'd love to see a 3D match engine.  Transfer tips: Sign Christian Pulisic and take a look at the free transfers, you can get Martin Caceres and Alex on a free in the first season and some other decent mid to high 80 players.  I'd love to see the microtransactions disappear. I wouldn't mind spending 10 - 15 bucks on this game to have no microtransactions and a 3D match engine.  One last thing, I'd also love to see a redesigned UI and more information on players and clubs, in similar fashion to Football Manager.
Oh God! That was aweful! I Don't Recommend this game.

I dont have much experience with Soccer Manager games, but I think this one is pretty decent. It has microtransactions but I would not necessarily say its full blown pay to win or anything. If you seem interested id recommend you just try it out yourself.

Very fun game, love how it includes clubs from all around the world, not just England and Spain like some other soccer games. One problem is that the matches are quite boring to watch, but it can get exciting if your team scores a goal or if your keeper makes a save. It is also very fun to compete against your friends. I give this game a 9.5/10.
